thread.title: LeBron James passes Shaquille O’Neal for 7th on all-time scoring list
thread.title_full: LeBron James passes Shaquille O’Neal for 7th on all-time scoring list

author: Whitney Medworth
title: LeBron James passes Shaquille O’Neal for 7th on all-time scoring list
text:
The historic career for LeBron James continues.
With his 24th point on Thursday night, LeBron James passed Shaquille O’Neal for the 7th on the NBA’s All-Time scoring list. James came out strong against the Bulls with 19 points in the first half. With a free throw late in the fourth quarter, James passed O’Neal with 28,597 points on his 24th point of the night.
James started the season in the 12th spot and has now moved all the way up 7th all-time. Next up for LeBron is Dirk Nowitzki, who reached 30,000 points earlier this season . James is already an all-time great but taking a look at this list really puts it into perceptive. Here are the six remaining players ahead of James:
Kareem Abdul-Jabbar - 38,387 Karl Malone - 36,928 Kobe Bryant - 33,643 Michael Jordan - 32,292 Wilt Chamberlain - 31,419 Dirk Nowitzki - 30,181 Congrats, LeBron!
